money.title: Zakat Calculator for Cash & Money - Calculate Zakat on Savings

debts.label: Debts owed by you
debts.placeholder: Enter the amount of debts in {currency}

conditions.title: Conditions for Cash Zakat
items: The money must reach the legally prescribed nisab
A full lunar year (354 days) must pass
The money must be surplus beyond basic needs
Debts owed to you are deducted from the money
Zakat rate: 2.5% of the net amount

madhabNote.hanafi: The Hanafi school uses the silver nisab (595 {gram}s) as it is easier on the poor and results in more zakat distribution. This means a lower nisab, thus more people are obligated to pay zakat.
madhabNote.others: The {madhab} school uses the gold nisab (85 {gram}s) as the basis for nisab calculation. This is the standard for zakat on money and savings.

goldSilver.title: Zakat Calculator for Gold & Silver - Calculate Zakat on Precious Metals

fiqhNote.title: Important Jurisprudence Note:
fiqhNote.description: Jewelry used for regular adornment: Scholars differ on zakat obligation. It is safer to pay zakat on it, especially if it is abundant or stored for investment.

conditions.title: Conditions for Gold and Silver Zakat:
items: Must reach the legally prescribed nisab
Must pass the full lunar year
Must be surplus beyond basic needs
Zakat is calculated on pure weight
Zakat rate: 2.5% of weight or value

inventory.label: Value of goods and inventory
inventory.placeholder: Enter the total value of goods in {currency}

receivables.label: Amounts owed to you - debtors
receivables.placeholder: Debts owed to you by customers in {currency}

payables.label: Debts owed by you
payables.placeholder: Debts owed by you to suppliers in {currency}

valuation.title: How to estimate the value of goods
items: Estimate goods at the current selling price (time of zakat)
Exclude stagnant or damaged goods
Deduct commercial debts owed to you
Add confirmed receivables from customers
Zakat rate: 2.5% of the net trade value

fiqhNote.title: Important Jurisprudence Note:
fiqhNote.description: Trade goods are valued at the selling price at the end of the lunar year, not the purchase price. This means zakat is calculated on the current market value of goods, ensuring fairness in zakat payment according to actual value.

agriculture.title: Zakat Calculator for Agriculture - Calculate Zakat on Crops & Produce

fiqhNote.title: Important Jurisprudence Note:
fiqhNote.description: Agricultural zakat differs from money zakat. Natural irrigation: 10% of harvest. Artificial irrigation: 5% of harvest. Calculated at harvest time, not at sale.

conditions.title: Conditions for Agricultural Zakat:
items: Harvest must reach the legally prescribed nisab
Crop must be from zakatable varieties
Zakat is calculated at harvest time, not sale
Natural irrigation: 10%, Artificial irrigation: 5%
Production costs are deducted from harvest value

livestock.title: Zakat Calculator for Livestock - Calculate Zakat on Farm Animals

calculationMethod.title: Calculation Method:
calculationMethod.valueDesc: Zakat with the value of animals

fiqhNote.title: Important Jurisprudence Note:
fiqhNote.description: Livestock zakat has specific texts in Quran and Sunnah. Cattle: nisab 30 heads, Sheep: nisab 40 heads, Camels: nisab 5 heads. Consult scholars in your country.

conditions.title: Conditions for Livestock Zakat:
items: Must reach the legally prescribed nisab for each type
Must pass the full lunar year
Must be grazing (feed on natural pasture)
Must not be for work or trade
Zakat is given from the same type of animals

nisab.title: Livestock Nisab:
nisab.cattleDesc: 30 heads = 1 male calf, 40 heads = 1 female cow

income.title: Zakat Calculator for Income & Salary - Calculate Zakat on Earnings

calculationMethod.title: Calculation Method:
calculationMethod.annualDesc: Collect income for a year then pay zakat

fiqhNote.title: Important Jurisprudence Note:
fiqhNote.description: Contemporary scholars differ on income zakat. Some see it as monthly for ease, others see it as collected for a year then zakat paid. Consult scholars in your country.

conditions.title: Conditions for Income Zakat:
items: Income must be surplus beyond basic needs
Must reach the legally prescribed nisab
Must be from permissible sources
Necessary expenses are deducted from income
Zakat rate: 2.5% of net income

rental.title: Zakat Calculator for Rental Income - Calculate Zakat on Property Rent

calculationMethod.title: Calculation Method:
calculationMethod.monthlyDesc: Pay zakat monthly when receiving rent
calculationMethod.annualDesc: Collect income for a year then pay zakat

fiqhNote.title: Important Jurisprudence Note:
fiqhNote.description: Scholars differ on rental zakat. Some see it as monthly when receiving rent, others see collecting it for a year then paying zakat. Consult scholars in your country.

conditions.title: Conditions for Rental Zakat:
items: Rent must be from a permissible property
Must reach the legally prescribed nisab
Rent must be surplus beyond basic needs
Deduct necessary expenses from rent
Zakat rate: 2.5% of net rent

holdingPeriod.title: Holding Period:
holdingPeriod.longDesc: Zakat on distributed and realized profits only

fiqhNote.title: Important Jurisprudence Note:
fiqhNote.description: Short-term investment (trading): Zakat on full market value. Long-term investment: Zakat on distributed and realized profits only. Consult scholars in your country.

conditions.title: Conditions for Investment Zakat:
items: Investments must be in permissible companies
Amount must reach the legally prescribed nisab
Must pass the lunar year
Investment fees are deducted from profits
Zakat rate: 2.5% of zakatable amount
